name: People Quiz: Laura Ingalls Wilder | 20 Questions

questions.text: When was Laura Elizabeth Ingalls Wilder born?
questions.explanation:
February 7, 1867.

	Mary Amelia Ingalls was born on January 10, 1865.  Caroline Celestia (Carrie) Ingalls was born on August 3, 1870.  Charles Frederick Ingalls was born on November 1, 1875.  Grace Pearl Ingalls was born on May 23, 1877.  These were the children of Charles and Caroline Ingalls.  In real life they did not adopt any children.

questions.text: Who were Laura's parents?
questions.explanation:
Charles and Caroline Ingalls.

	Charles Phillip Ingalls was born on January 10, 1836.  Caroline Lake Quiner Ingalls was born on December 12, 1839.  They were married on February 1, 1860.

questions.text: Laura lived near Pepin, Wisconsin in which book?
questions.correct: Little House in the Big Woods
options: On the Banks of Plum Creek
On the Shores of Silver Lake
questions.explanation:
Little House in the Big Woods.

	The town of Pepin was first built on the lake shore and then extended up the bluffs that rise to the east.  Lake Pepin is an expansion of the Mississippi River, thirty miles long and three miles wide at its widest.  When Laura wrote about one trip to town she said, "Laura gathered so many pebbles from the shore of Lake Pepin that they tore the pocket from her dress."

questions.text: What year was "Little House in the Big Woods" published?
questions.explanation:
1932.

	"Little House in the Big Woods" described her life as a small child in the Big Woods of Wisconsin.  They left the Big Woods in 1869 and moved to Kansas.

questions.text: Which book describes their life in Kansas?
options: On the Banks of Plum Creek
Little House in the Big Woods
questions.explanation:
Little House on the Prairie.

	Even though Laura's books say that Carrie was already born when they moved to Kansas, she was not.  Caroline Celestia Ingalls was born in Montgomery County, Kansas.

questions.text: How far from the town of Independence, Kansas did the Ingalls live?
questions.explanation:
about 13 miles.

	In "Little House on the Prairie" Laura said they lived about 40 miles from Independence.  According to old land and census records they actually lived about 13 miles from town.

questions.text: The Ingalls left Kansas and moved back to Wisconsin.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In 1871, they left Kansas and moved back to Wisconsin.  In 1874, Pa sold the farm a second time and moved to western Minnesota.  They settled near the town of Walnut Grove.

questions.text: Their first house in Minnesota was actually a dugout?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Charles and Caroline Ingalls bought 172 acres in North Hero Township, Redwood County, Minnesota.  The farm was two miles north of Walnut Grove.  In the bank of Plum Creek is where the dugout was.

questions.text: What was the name of the hotel that Charles helped run in Burr Oak, Iowa?
questions.explanation:
Masters Hotel.

	When crops were ruined once again in 1876, Pa said he had had enough.  Mr. Steadman, a friend from church, had bought the Masters Hotel in Burr Oak and had asked Pa to come help him operate the business.  Pa agreed.

questions.text: The Ingalls moved back to Walnut Grove from Iowa.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After a year in Burr Oak, the Ingalls returned to Walnut Grove.  It was during that time the family was stricken with scarlet fever.  The doctors called it "brain fever."  The scarlet fever left 14-year-old Mary blind.

questions.text: In 1879, the Ingalls family moved to Dakota Territory.  Where did they settle?
questions.explanation:
De Smet.

	Charles and Caroline never moved again.  They are buried in the De Smet Cemetery.

questions.text: When did Laura and Almanzo marry?
questions.explanation:
August 25, 1885.

	Laura was seventeen when Almanzo asked her to marry him.  She agreed, but made him promise that their wedding ceremony would not ask that she obey him.

questions.text: When was Almanzo James Wilder born?
questions.explanation:
February 13, 1857.

	Almanzo was born in near Malone, New York.  He died in Mansfield, Missouri on October 23, 1949 at the age of 92.

questions.text: How many children did Laura and Almanzo have?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Rose Wilder was born on December 5, 1886 in De Smet.  An infant son was born and died in August 1889.  Laura and Almanzo had not named their son before he passed away.  Two weeks after their son passed away, their house burned.

questions.text: Laura and Almanzo's final home was in Mansfield, Missouri.  What did they name their farm?
questions.explanation:
Rocky Ridge Farm.

	They named the farm Rocky Ridge because the land was so rocky.  Laura wrote all of her books at Rocky Ridge.

questions.text: Laura wrote a total of nine books.  Which book is about Almanzo as a boy?
questions.explanation:
Farmer Boy.

	"Farmer Boy" took place when Almanzo was around 9-years-old.  "The First Four Years" was about Laura and Almanzo's first four years of marriage.  "These Happy Golden Years" was about when she and Almanzo were courting.  "Little House in the Ozarks" was about when Rose was a little girl.  That was written by Roger Lea McBride.

questions.text: Did Laura and Almanzo have any grandchildren?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Rose married Claire Gillette Lane on March 24, 1909.  They had an infant son that was born and died in 1910.  Rose and Gillette divorced in 1918.  Rose never remarried.

questions.text: How long were Laura and Almanzo married?
questions.explanation:
64 years.

	Laura and Almanzo celebrated their 64th wedding anniversary in August before Almanzo passed away in October 1949.

questions.text: When was "The First Four Years" published?
questions.explanation:
1971.

	"The First Four Years" was not published during Laura's lifetime.  It was published 14 years after her death from her original penciled manuscripts.

questions.text: When did Laura die?
questions.explanation:
February 10, 1957.

	She passed away three days after her 90th birthday.  She is buried next to Almanzo in the Mansfield Cemetery.  Rocky Ridge Farm is open to the public for tours.
